trans-unit.source: Step 5: Connect to the virtual machine and finish the installation
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Connect to the virtual machine and finish the installation

trans-unit.source: In order to finish building your virtual machine, you need to start the VM and walk through the operating system installation.
trans-unit.target: In order to finish building your virtual machine, you need to start the VM and walk through the operating system installation.

trans-unit.source: In **Hyper-V Manager**, double-click on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In **Hyper-V Manager**, double-click on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This will launch the VMConnect tool.
trans-unit.target: This will launch the VMConnect tool.

trans-unit.source: In VMConnect, click on the green **Start** button ![](media/start.png).
trans-unit.target: In VMConnect, click on the green **Start** button ![](media/start.png).

trans-unit.source: This is like hitting the power button on a physical computer.
trans-unit.target: This is like hitting the power button on a physical computer.

trans-unit.source: The VM will boot into setup and you can walk through the installation like you would on a physical computer.
trans-unit.target: The VM will boot into setup and you can walk through the installation like you would on a physical computer.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** Unless you're running a volume licensed version of Windows 10, you do need a seperate license for Windows running inside a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** Unless you're running a volume licensed version of Windows 10, you do need a seperate license for Windows running inside a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine's operating system is completely independent of the host operating system.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine's operating system is completely independent of the host operating system.

trans-unit.source: Other stuff you can do in VMConnect
trans-unit.target: Other stuff you can do in VMConnect

trans-unit.source: Here are all of the buttons and shortcut keys, mapped to what they do.
trans-unit.target: Here are all of the buttons and shortcut keys, mapped to what they do.

trans-unit.source: Send CTRL+ALT+DELETE to the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Send CTRL+ALT+DELETE to the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Switch from full-screen mode back to windowed mode
trans-unit.target: Switch from full-screen mode back to windowed mode

trans-unit.source: Open the settings for the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Open the settings for the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Return mouse clicks or keyboard input to the physical computer
trans-unit.target: Return mouse clicks or keyboard input to the physical computer

trans-unit.source: Press CTRL+ALT+LEFT arrow and then move the mouse pointer outside of the virtual machine window.
trans-unit.target: Press CTRL+ALT+LEFT arrow and then move the mouse pointer outside of the virtual machine window.

trans-unit.source: This is the **mouse release key combination** and it can be changed in the **Hyper-V settings** in **Hyper-V Manager**.
trans-unit.target: This is the **mouse release key combination** and it can be changed in the **Hyper-V settings** in **Hyper-V Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Send mouse clicks or keyboard input to the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Send mouse clicks or keyboard input to the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Click anywhere in the virtual machine window.
trans-unit.target: Click anywhere in the virtual machine window.

trans-unit.source: The mouse pointer may appear as a small dot when you connect to a running virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The mouse pointer may appear as a small dot when you connect to a running virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Change the settings of the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Change the settings of the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Connect to a DVD image (.iso file) or a virtual floppy disk (.vfd file)
trans-unit.target: Connect to a DVD image (.iso file) or a virtual floppy disk (.vfd file)

trans-unit.source: Virtual floppy disks are not supported for generation 2 virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Virtual floppy disks are not supported for generation 2 virtual machines.
